desc: Fog and rain stitch the black water to the pier.
Ropes groan. Lanterns rattle against their hooks.
Your cloak drinks the night. Somewhere, a gull laughs once.
You lean over the slick rail. Rain beads the surface into a single moving mirror.
Below: ladders descending into a throat. Nothing stirs but the tide.

options.label: Back to the end of the pier

desc: A locked plank door under a lopsided awning. Water drums the lintel.

check.logFormat: Sleight of Hand check: d20({roll}) +{bonus} = {total} vs DC {dc} → {result}

onFail.log: The ward bites back. Your fingers go wooden with the cold.

desc: Inside: ledgers swollen with damp, a cold stove, a single stool—
nothing to take but the quiet.
The pick skates. The dock office remains shut.
You feel the cold deepen with the hour.

options.label: Back to the end of the pier

desc: Wicker mounds huddle against the wall, gleaming with rain.
Beneath a crust of netting you find a brass tally token stamped with a gull.
